title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Stocks fell ahead of the Fed's next policy decision as investors grappled with the impact of rising interest rates on corporate earnings and valuations. The S&P 500 lost 1.1%, while the Dow and Nasdaq both retreated 1%. Treasury yields again rose to multiyear highs.

---

Chamath Palihapitiya, one of the biggest promoters of SPACs, is shutting down two deal-making efforts that together hold over $1.6 billion after the market collapsed, wiping out tens of billions in startup market value and punishing individual investors.

---

Gap is eliminating about 500 corporate jobs, according to people familiar with the matter, moving to reduce expenses amid declining sales and profits.

---

China's Tencent is looking into shedding more of its huge investment portfolio as the company tries to fund a series of share buybacks and refocus its growth strategy.

---

Republican attorneys general of 23 states are warning Visa, Mastercard and American Express not to move forward with their plan to add a new code to identify when purchases are made at firearms retailers.

---

The FTC is investigating Amazon.com's proposal to acquire iRobot, which makes the Roomba robot vacuum cleaner, according to a securities filing.

---

Nordstrom adopted a so-called poison pill to prevent outsiders from boosting their stake in the business after a Mexican company acquired a 9.9% stake in the retailer.
